meanings.definition: Moving continuously or freely through a closed system or area.
meanings.sent1: The air conditioning system keeps the cool air circulating throughout the room.
meanings.sent2: The circulating water in the fountain creates a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the ghost circulating in the old house scared the children.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts of doubt were circulating in her mind like a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The circulating red blood cells carry oxygen to all parts of the body.

meanings.definition: Passing from person to person or place to place.
meanings.sent1: The circulating flu virus affected many people in the community.
meanings.sent2: The circulating news about the upcoming event spread quickly.
meanings.sent3: The circulating joke at school made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Gossip was circulating around the office like a game of telephone.
meanings.sent5: The circulating library book was enjoyed by many readers.

meanings.sent1: The circulating currency in the country is widely accepted.
meanings.sent2: The circulating fashion trend influenced many young people.
meanings.sent3: The circulating idea of kindness made the world a better place.
meanings.sent4: Hope was circulating in the air like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The circulating music hit became a favorite among listeners.
